attributes.action: Restore the right of British citizens to freely access the EU labour market
attributes.additional_details: Millions of British citizens are excluded from freely accessing the EU labour market on par with nationals of EU member states. When applying for employment in an EU member state British citizens will only be considered if the national of an EU member state cannot fill the vacancy. This will disproportionately affect people who cannot meet the income thresholds for emigration to EU member states, and therefore is likely to be more detrimental to people from lower socio-economic backgrounds.
attributes.background: Restore the right of British citizens to freely access the EU labour market on par with the nationals of EU countries

rejection.details:
Rights for British citizens to work in the EU is a matter for the EU and individual EU nations, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Seek to agree freedom of movement in the UK and EU for British and EU citizens: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556757
